channel.title: Heart Rate Variability Podcast
channel.description: Welcome to the Heart Rate Variability Podcast where we discuss the research and applications of heart rate variability.
channel.itunes:author: Matt Bennett and Jeff Somers
channel.itunes:summary: Welcome to the Heart Rate Variability Podcast where we discuss the research and applications of heart rate variability.

item.title: Further Exploration of Job-Demands and Resource Model
item.dc:creator: Matthew Bennett
item.description: In this episode, Jeff and Matt continue their exploration into Job-Demands and Resources. We look at how Job Resources counteract stress, prevents burnout, and promote engagement. Also, we explore how heart rate variability can add new insight to this well-established model.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode, Jeff and Matt continue their exploration into Job-Demands and Resources. We look at how Job Resources counteract stress, prevents burnout, and promote engagement. Also, we explore how heart rate variability can add new insight to this we
item.itunes:keywords: burnout,heart rate variability,hrv,hrv business,jeff somers,job demand,job resources,matt bennett

item.title: Job Demand & Resource Model
item.dc:creator: Matthew Bennett
item.description: In our first episode of 2021, Jeff and Matt discuss one of the best-researched models of work stress, the Job Demands & Resources Model. There is a great deal of insight into how this model can help us understand our own wellness and productivity and those of teams and organizations. We will also explore how heart rate variability helps quantify the impact of job demands and whether our self-care and job resources keep us healthy or burn us out.

item.title: Becca Sheade Joins the Show to Talk HRV in Occupational Therapy
item.dc:creator: Matthew Bennett
item.description:
We are excited to have our first guest, Becca Sheade founder of Elgin Pediatric Therapy. Learn how Becca has integrated HRV into her practice and some of the exciting results.

Find out more about the great working being done at Becca’s clinic: http://elginpediatrictherapy.com/ & becca@elginpediatrictherapy.com

item.itunes:author: Matthew Bennett

item.title: Heart Rate Variability Time Off
item.dc:creator: Matthew Bennett
item.description: In this episode, Jeff and Matt explore the concept of HRV friendly time off and vacations. How we choose to spend our time off will determine whether we recover or wear ourselves down even more. Learn some best practices on this episode to come back from vacation refreshed and healthy.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode, Jeff and Matt explore the concept of HRV friendly time off and vacations. How we choose to spend our time off will determine whether we recover or wear ourselves down even more. Learn some best practices on this episode to come back from
item.itunes:keywords: burnout,heart rate variability,hrv,hrv business,jeff somers,matt bennett,time off,vacation

item.title: Heart Rate Variability & Leadership
item.dc:creator: Matthew Bennett
item.description: In this episode, Jeff and Matt discuss how leaders can use HRV as a competitive advantage. There is a direct connection between mental health, productivity, and outcomes. HRV help quantify the mental health of the workforce providing leaders a key insight into performance and engagement.

item.title: Team Health & Heart Rate Variability
item.dc:creator: Matthew Bennett
item.description: In this episode, Jeff and Matt discuss how HRV quantified team and organizational health. Traditionally, we have struggled to measure the impact of employee health and wellness on productivity, engagement, and quality. HRV provides a key organizational quality measure for the health of the workforce.

item.title: Self-care & Heart Rate Variability
item.dc:creator: Matthew Bennett
item.description: In this episode, Matt and Jeff discuss how HRV can help quantify our self-care efforts and warn us about burnout.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode, Matt and Jeff discuss how HRV can help quantify our self-care efforts and warn us about burnout.
